titleStmt.title: A plot discovered, in which, divers cavaliers of Scotland should have surprised Barwick. Also how the Marquesse of Arguile, the Earle of Crawford Linsey, Earl of Lanerick, and Major Innis, met in the field upon a challenge to fight, and the proceedings of the Parliament therein. With five propositions concerning the King, the amity of the kingdomes, reformation in religion, and the keeping of the Covenant. Agreed on by the Generall Assembly of the Kirk, and presented to the Parliament of Scotland, March I. 1647. And published for the members of that church and kingdome, and brethren of the ministery.
titleStmt.author: Stuart, George.
Ker, A.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for H. Becke, and are to be sold in the Old Bayley,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 21 1647"; the 8 in imprint date is crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
